byline.original: By JODI RUDOREN and RAMI NAZZAL

abstract: Musicians in occupied West Bank and beyond have created many militaristic, often violent songs, fueled by recent wave of Palestinian attacks against Israeli Jews and deadly battles with Israeli security troops; Palestinians have tradition of protest music, but experts say style and scale of new songs are unusual, and coupled with graphic videos on social media, are forming something of an intifada soundtrack.
lead_paragraph: The political songs, which have a strong following among teenagers, are “made as a way to make the Palestinian people get up and resist,” said a Ramallah music shop owner.

headline.main: Palestinian Anger in Jerusalem and West Bank Gets a Violent Soundtrack
headline.print_headline: Palestinians Set Their Rage to Violent Beat

snippet: The political songs, which have a strong following among teenagers, are “made as a way to make the Palestinian people get up and resist,” said a Ramallah music shop owner.
